questions.text: A child was born with herinating bowel from a abdominal defect. Which of the following is a wrong statement about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Usually the defect is in the right abdominal wall.

options.label: B
options.text: Intestine is not covered with sac

options.label: C
options.text: Bowel atresia is more common in this condition than omphalocele

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate reduction of bowel in abdominal cavity and repair should be done in all cases.

questions.correct_answer: D. Immediate reduction of bowel in abdominal cavity and repair should be done in all cases.

questions.text: Identify the surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Duodenal switch- Mainly malabsorptive and mildly restrictive

options.label: B
options.text: SADI S - Mainly malabsorptive and mildly restrictive

options.label: C
options.text: Duodenal switch- Mainly restrictive and mildly malabsorptive

options.label: D
options.text: SADI S- Mainly restrictive and mildly malabsorptive

questions.correct_answer: B. SADI S - Mainly malabsorptive and mildly restrictive

questions.text: Which of the following is not a common associated finding of severe Posterior Urethral Valve?
A 50 year old man comes with complain of poor stream of urine. RGU showed a passable stricture at bulbo-membranous junction. What is the best treatment for him?
Identify the position?
Which of the following about Paget’s disease is false?

options.label: B
options.text: Presents as unilateral eczematous lesion on nipple

options.label: D
options.text: Most Paget’s disease are CEA positive

questions.correct_answer: A. It has abundant basophilic cytoplasm

questions.text: A 30 year old female presented with a 3 cm lump in right breast. She observed the lump 2 year ago snice then it is gradually increasing in size. There is no complain of pain, discharge or redness. On examination the lump is firm, rubbery and freely mobile. Mammographic image is given below. What is the ideal treatment for her?
A 65 year old male presented with a small ulcer just lateral and above the right lip. The ulcer has rolled over border and telangiectasia on surface. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 35 year old man presented with upper abdominal mild pain, early satiety and a lump. On examination the lump is in upper abdomen, not moving with respiration. He gives history of trauma in upper abdomen in a brawl, 4 weeks ago. CVT image is given below. What is the most probable diagnosis?
35 year old male presented with 1 year history of fever anorexia and weight loss. Contrast image of the bowel is given below. What is the possible diagnosis in this patient?
34 year old female with mass in inguinal region which reduces completely on pressure with gurgling sound through deep inguinal ring. Possible diagnosis?
What is the most common complication while inserting the following catheter?
Which of the following is commonly injured in primary blast injury
Nezelof syndrome is a recurrent occurrence of ?

options.label: B
options.text: Used in any case of acute urinary retention

options.label: D
options.text: Used for urethral dilatation after urethral stricture surgery.

questions.correct_answer: A. Post TURP irrigation of bladder

questions.text: In video assisted thoracoscopic surgery for better vision the space in the operative field is created by ?
Which tumour is exclusively found in parotid gland?

After removal of parotid gland, patient is having sweating on the cheeks while eating. In this complication seen after parotidectomy, the auriculotemporal nerve which contains parasympathetic secretomotor fibers to parotid gland is fused with which nerve?

A 61-year-old man with a history of diabetes mellitus type 2, coronary artery disease, and chronic kidney disease presented to the emergency department with chest pain. A coronary angiogram is ordered and is essentially unremarkable. The following day the patient experienced tachycardia, diarrhea, and increased sweating. This change in status was reported to the on-call clinician, who ordered a thyroid profile of the patient. The thyroid profile shows elevated T3 and T4 and reduced TSH levels. The provider explains the patient is exhibiting an uncommon thyrotoxic phenomenon. Which of the following was responsible for the patient's condition?
questions.correct_answer: B. Exposure to iodine-containing contrast medium

questions.text: The most common site of extopic pherochromo-cytoma
A female patient after laparoscopic cholecystectomy presented with cystic duct stump leak What should be the immediate management?
Neuroendocrine tumour of pancreas associated with necrolytic erythema migrans:
Which of the following statements is true regarding carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA)?

options.label: A
options.text: CEA is an accurate screening test for primary colorectal cancer

options.label: B
options.text: CEA levels, when elevated, are highly specific for colon cancer

options.label: C
options.text: CEA is present in normal colonic mucosa

options.label: D
options.text: Postoperative CEA assay is 70% accurate in predicting the appearance of liver metastases within 1

questions.correct_answer: D. Postoperative CEA assay is 70% accurate in predicting the appearance of liver metastases within 1

questions.text: False statement about Hereditary diffuse gastric cancer is?

options.label: A
options.text: It has a autosomal dominant inheritance

options.label: B
options.text: Gene involved is CDH1 (E Cadherin mutation)

options.label: C
options.text: It leads to Linitis Plastica of stomach

options.label: D
options.text: This condition is associated with higher risk of Infiltrating ductal breast cancer

questions.correct_answer: D. This condition is associated with higher risk of Infiltrating ductal breast cancer

questions.text: Following image is an example of which type of drain?
What is the Paris Agreement, and what is its goal?

options.label: A
options.text: An international treaty on space exploration

options.label: B
options.text: An agreement to limit global temperature rise to well below 2°C compared to pre-industrial levels

options.label: C
options.text: A trade agreement between various countries

options.label: D
options.text: A national policy in one country to address climate change

questions.correct_answer: B. An agreement to limit global temperature rise to well below 2°C compared to pre-industrial levels

questions.text: What does a positive value of the regression coefficient (b) in a simple linear regression model indicate?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no relationship between the independent and dependent variables.

options.label: B
options.text: As the independent variable increases, the dependent variable decreases.

options.label: C
options.text: There is a perfect positive correlation between the independent and dependent variables.

options.label: D
options.text: As the independent variable increases, the dependent variable also increases.

questions.correct_answer: D. As the independent variable increases, the dependent variable also increases.

questions.text: A p-value of 0.02 in a study comparing two drug treatments means:

options.label: A
options.text: The null hypothesis is definitely true.

options.label: B
options.text: There is a 2% chance the observed difference is due to random chance.

options.label: C
options.text: The alternative hypothesis is statistically significant at the 5% level.

options.label: D
options.text: The observed difference is too small to be meaningful.

questions.correct_answer: C. The alternative hypothesis is statistically significant at the 5% level.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a type of bias that can affect RCTs?

options.label: A
options.text: Selection bias: Participants are not representative of the target population.

options.label: B
options.text: Performance bias: Participants in different groups behave differently.

options.label: C
options.text: Detection bias: Outcomes are measured differently for different groups.

options.label: D
options.text: Placebo effect: Improvement in the control group due to expectation or psychological factors.

questions.correct_answer: A. Selection bias: Participants are not representative of the target population.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Selection bias occurs before groups are formed, not due to treatment allocation within an RCT.

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the design of a case-crossover study?

options.label: A
options.text: Comparing outcomes in a single group before and after an intervention.

options.label: B
options.text: Observing exposures and outcomes in two matched groups simultaneously.

options.label: C
options.text: Analysing past exposures associated with a present outcome in individual cases.

options.label: D
options.text: Tracking changes in exposure and outcome over time in a defined population.

questions.correct_answer: C. Analysing past exposures associated with a present outcome in individual cases.

questions.text: What does this image depict?
Which of the following factors is used in calculating the PQLI??

options.label: D
options.text: Access to clean water and sanitation

questions.text: Which of the following statements about specificity is TRUE?

options.label: A
options.text: A specificity of 80% means the test will incorrectly identify 20% of healthy individuals as having the condition.

options.label: B
options.text: A higher specificity score is always better, regardless of sensitivity.

options.label: C
options.text: Specificity is the same as sensitivity.

options.label: D
options.text: A test with perfect specificity will identify all true negatives but may also have false negatives.

questions.correct_answer: A. A specificity of 80% means the test will incorrectly identify 20% of healthy individuals as having the condition.

questions.text: Which of the following can’t decrease the value of R₀?

options.label: A
options.text: Increasing the infectious period of the disease.

questions.correct_answer: A. Increasing the infectious period of the disease.

questions.text: What is the primary function of a vaccine vial monitor (VVM)?

options.label: A
options.text: To track the location of individual vaccine vials.

options.label: B
options.text: To indicate whether a vaccine has been exposed to extreme temperatures.

options.label: C
options.text: To monitor the sterility of the vaccine before it is administered.

options.label: D
options.text: To verify the authenticity of the vaccine brand.

questions.correct_answer: B. To indicate whether a vaccine has been exposed to extreme temperatures.

questions.text: Which population groups does WHO STEPS target?

options.label: B
options.text: Children and adolescents under 18 years only.

options.label: D
options.text: All age groups, including infants and older adults.

questions.text: Which of the following is a key component of the IMNCI approach?

options.label: A
options.text: Using specialized diagnostic equipment to identify illnesses.

options.label: B
options.text: Relying solely on doctors for treatment decisions.

options.label: C
options.text: Training frontline health workers to assess and classify illnesses.

options.label: D
options.text: Focusing only on preventive measures, not curative care

questions.correct_answer: C. Training frontline health workers to assess and classify illnesses.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Integrated Management of Neonatal and Childhood Illness (IMNCI)
  • • • WHO + UNICEF
  • • • Colour coded: Pink/ Yellow/ Green
  • • • Objective: prevent deaths of child from preventable causes by standard case management
  • • • Modules:
  • • – Split into 2 parts
  • • – 0-2 months & 2 months to 5 years
  • • • LACT – Look, Access, Classify, Treat
  • • • Major highlights of Indian version of IMNCI is:
  • • – Inclusion of 0- 7 days age in the programme (IMCI globally)
  • • – Incorporating national guidelines on malaria, anaemia, vitamin A supplementation & immunization schedule
  • • • IMNCI Training highlights:
  • • – Training of health personnel begins with sick young infants up to 2 months of age
  • • – Skill based
  • • – Proportion of time for training devoted to sick young infant & sick child is almost equal
  • • • Colour Coding for IMNCI:

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a component of Ayushman Bharat?

options.label: A
options.text: Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PMJAY) - providing health insurance coverage.

options.label: B
options.text: Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission - upgrading healthcare facilities.

options.label: C
options.text: Ayushman Bharat Digital Mission - creating a national health data platform.

options.label: D
options.text: National Health Protection Mission - improving health services delivery.

questions.text: Which metric is commonly used in CUA to measure health outcomes?

options.label: A
options.text: Quality-adjusted life years (QALYs) - measures both length and quality of life.

options.label: B
options.text: Life expectancy alone - only considers how long a person lives.

options.label: C
options.text: Cost per case prevented - focuses solely on avoiding disease cases.

options.label: D
options.text: Number of lives saved - only looks at mortality reduction.

questions.correct_answer: A. Quality-adjusted life years (QALYs) - measures both length and quality of life.
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • QALYs allow for comparing interventions affecting different diseases and durations, making them the preferred metric in CUA.
  • • Economic Evaluation:

questions.text: During a flood emergency, what should be the immediate priority for rescue teams?

options.label: A
options.text: Assessing the overall damage and potential environmental hazards.

options.label: B
options.text: Providing food and shelter to displaced individuals.

options.label: C
options.text: Restoring critical infrastructure like electricity and communication networks.

options.label: D
options.text: Locating and rescuing individuals trapped in floodwaters or collapsed buildings.

questions.correct_answer: D. Locating and rescuing individuals trapped in floodwaters or collapsed buildings.

questions.text: A 2 yrs old child present with scaly lesions on scalp, alopecia and dermatitis. Mother gives a history of consumption of raw egg. Deficiency of which vitamin should be suspected?
A 6yrs old boy with muscular pain which includes calf, fatigue and exercise intolerance. What can be the most probable diagnosis?
All of the following are recommendations for treatment of mild to moderate acute rheumatic carditis EXCEPT:

A 3-year-old girl is admitted for evaluation of persistent fever. She has had a daily fever for the last 7 days of at least 38.8°C (102°F). Her mother describes her as generally more irritable over this time. She developed a diffuse maculopapular rash yesterday. On exam, you find her quite irritable and uncooperative with the exam. She is febrile to 103.2°F. She has bilateral conjunctivitis, dry, peeling lips, swollen hands, and a diffuse maculopapular rash. She subsequently receives IVIG and an echocardiogram to evaluate for coronary aneurysms. No aneurysms were seen on this study. She becomes afebrile after receiving IVIG with down-trending inflammatory markers and is discharged home. What treatment and follow up are needed?

You are seeing an 8-year-old girl for the first time in your practice for a well-child visit. She is otherwise healthy with an unremarkable past medical history. Her vital signs are within normal limits but her height plots at less than the fifth percentile. She also has a low posterior hairline and a webbed neck. All of the following are associated with her syndrome EXCEPT:

A 3-year-old girl with a new baby sister presents with recent refusal to walk. She is crawling now and refuses to stand by herself, wanting to be carried. She has a previous history of eczema. On exam, she has a rash over the knuckles, elbows, and knees; gum hyperemia; and nail beds that show periungual erythema and swelling. Her laboratory testing shows the following results (normal values in parentheses) : ALT 200 units/L (10-25 units/L); AST 350 units/L (10-30 units/L) Creatine kinase (CK) 600 units/L (20-200 units/L) Lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) 400 units/L ( 110-295 units/L) ESR 27 mm/h (0- 15 mm/h) Urinalysis normal; CBC normal What is the diagnosis?

A 4-month-old infant arrives in the emergency department with a 2-day history of fever, decreasing interest in oral (PO) intake, and little to no urine output today. Mother notes that the patient is more lethargic today. Upon examination you note a well-nourished infant who arouses and moans to your exam but quickly falls back asleep in his mother's arms. Vital signs are heart rate (HR) : 170 beats per minute (bpm}, respiratory rate (RR} : 60 breaths per minute, blood pressure (BP} : 80/60 mm Hg, temperature (T} : 38°C ( 100.4°F) . Multiple attempts to obtain intravenous (IV) access are unsuccessful. What is the most appropriate next therapy?

options.label: C
options.text: Obtain intraosseous (IO) access and administer a 20-mL/kg isotonic fluid bolus via IO.

questions.correct_answer: C. Obtain intraosseous (IO) access and administer a 20-mL/kg isotonic fluid bolus via IO.

questions.text: A 24-month old boy is brought in by his parents to establish pediatric care. He is short statured. Over the past several months, he has developed progressive leg bowing. On exam he has frontal bossing, nontender palpable lumps along his costochondral junctions, and wide wrists. His family isn't worried since the patient has an uncle and a brother with a similar features. What is the most likely laboratory finding?

A 39-week gestational age infant is born after prolonged rupture of membranes. The membranes ruptured 48 hours before admission, and the mother presented to the hospital with a temperature of 39.4°C ( 103°F), foul-smelling amniotic fluid, and severe abdominal pain. She is started on antibiotics shortly before delivery. The infant is born by cesarean delivery due to persistent fetal tachycardia and concerns for maternal chorioamnionitis. Apgar scores are 8 and 8. The infant is initially vigorous and is placed on the mother's chest for transition. The infant is brought to the NICU for evaluation due to suspected maternal chorioamnionitis and develops respiratory distress within hours of admission. Findings include tachypnea, mild retractions, and grunting respirations. Her chest radiograph has patchy infiltrates bilaterally. You are asked to update her family. You tell them:

options.label: A
options.text: This is most consistent with neonatal pneumonia and sepsis. You will continue antibiotics and she will likely recover in several days to a week.

options.label: B
options.text: This is most consistent with respiratory distress syndrome resulting from surfactant deficiency. She may need to be intubated for surfactant administration.

options.label: C
options.text: This is most consistent with transient tachypnea of the newborn and fluid retention exacerbated by cesarean delivery without labor. She will improve in the next 24 hours.

options.label: D
options.text: This is most consistent with tension pneumothorax.

questions.correct_answer: A. This is most consistent with neonatal pneumonia and sepsis. You will continue antibiotics and she will likely recover in several days to a week.

questions.text: What is the most common cause of neonatal meningitis across the world?

Sotalol causes QT prolongation C. Labetalol has norepinephrine reuptake inhibitory activity D. Nebivolol has insulin sensitizing property E. Propranolol indicated in infantile haemangioma

options.label: A
options.text: A- T, B- T, C- F, D- F, E- F

options.label: B
options.text: A- T, B- F, C- F, D- F, E- F

options.label: C
options.text: A- F, B- T, C- T, D- T, E- T

options.label: D
options.text: A- F, B- T, C- F, D- F, E- F

questions.correct_answer: C. A- F, B- T, C- T, D- T, E- T

questions.text: 51-year-old female patient complains of bilateral hearing loss for the 2 year. On examination, tympanic membrane is normal and audiogram shows a bilateral conductive deafness. Impedance audiometry shows As type of curve and acoustic reflexes are absent. Which of the following is not resected during surgical intervention:
Use of a Passy-Muir speaking valve is contraindicated in the presence of: 1. Cognitive dysfunction 2. Presence of a cuffed tracheostomy tube 3. Upper airway obstruction 4. Severe tracheal stenosis

A 70-year-old male presents with sudden left ear hearing loss without any triggering factors, lasting for two days already. He also complained of continuous high-pitch tinnitus in the same ear. His audiogram showed severe sensorineural hearing loss after 3000Hz, with SRI of 92% and SRT of 15 dB in his left ear; his right ear was within normal limits. MRI was ordered, this time showing an expansive solid mass, measuring 5mm in diameter, inside the internal acoustic meatus. Choose the most appropriate statement.

options.label: A
options.text: Most common nerve involved is cochlear nerve.

options.label: B
options.text: Earliest sign is loss of sensation in external auditory meatus.

options.label: C
options.text: First nerve to have pressure symptom is facial.

options.label: D
options.text: Involvement of trigeminal nerve indicates that the tumor is roughly 2.5 cm in diameter

questions.correct_answer: D. Involvement of trigeminal nerve indicates that the tumor is roughly 2.5 cm in diameter

questions.text: All of the following nerve grafts can be used in facial nerve injury except:
A normal adult’s ear canal volume ranges between which of the following?
Spontaneous hearing recovery after a sudden sensorineural hearing loss, if it is to occur, occurs within what time frame?

A 5 year old child was operated for tonsillectomy under general anaesthesia. In the evening, patient develops neck spasm and is excessively crying. MRI Neck shows atlantoaxial subluxation.All of the following statements are true regarding complication except?

options.label: B
options.text: Early management, consisting of cervical immobilization

options.label: C
options.text: Is more common in tonsillectomy than adenoidectomy.

options.label: D
options.text: This complication is more common in Down’s syndrome children.

questions.correct_answer: C. Is more common in tonsillectomy than adenoidectomy.

questions.text: The patient is a 5 year old male brought in by his mother. He has had a low grade fever of 100 for 3 days. He is complaining that his ears hurt with difficulty sleeping. He also has a non-productive cough that started yesterday. Examination of both ears reveals significant redness and fluid in both middle ears with no apparent involvement of the eardrum or tympanic membrane. What type of tympanogram will be seen in given clinical scenario ?

Laryngoscopic examination of the vocal folds after suspected recurrent laryngeal nerve damage usually shows that the vocal fold on the injured side is tensed and in an intermediate position between adduction and abduction. This is because

options.label: A
options.text: Cricothyroid muscle is still functional but the interarytenoid muscles are fully active.

options.label: B
options.text: Cricothyroid muscle is still functional but the interarytenoid are weak.

options.label: C
options.text: Cricothyroid muscle is paralyzed but the interarytenoid are fully active.

options.label: D
options.text: Cricothyroid muscle is paralyzed but the interarytenoid are weak.

questions.correct_answer: B. Cricothyroid muscle is still functional but the interarytenoid are weak.

questions.text: All of the following are indications necessitating tracheostomy except:

options.label: B
options.text: Patients in whom endotracheal intubation is continued for more than about 3 weeks.

options.label: C
options.text: A single failed attempt at endotracheal intubation in a child with acute supraglottitis.

options.label: D
options.text: Laryngeal trauma with evidence of frothy blood.

questions.correct_answer: A. A child with acute laryngotracheobronchitis.

questions.text: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the OPD for rapid and irregular movements of his hands for one week. His parents say that he is also making unintentional "funny faces" and has trouble controlling the volume of his voice. His temperature is 38.9 deg C. On physical examination, the boy moves his hands frequently and erratically. He has a new IIIA/I systolic murmur and several circular, faintly erythematous lesions on his abdomen. Which of the following is the most likely mechanism for this patient's condition?

options.label: B
options.text: Cross-reactivity of antibodies against bacterial and host antigens

questions.correct_answer: B. Cross-reactivity of antibodies against bacterial and host antigens

questions.text: A 21-year-old man comes to the urgent care clinic with a lesion on his penis. He noticed a painful ulcer on the right side of his penis 4 days ago and it has progressively increased in size since then. The patient has had no dysuria, hematuria, or penile discharge. He is a tourist visiting New York City from Botswana. He is HIV-positive and is sexually active. The patient currently takes no medications. He appears comfortable and is afebrile. On genitourinary examination, there is a 1.5-cm ulceration on the right side of the base of the penis; the lesion is very tender and soft; has irregular, ragged borders; and is covered with grey exudate. There is a palpable, tender, enlarged inguinal lymph node in the right groin. The examination is otherwise unremarkable. A scraping of the ulcer is performed. Polymerase chain reaction testing for herpes simplex virus is negative, and darkfield microscopy reveals no organisms. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 5-year-old girl is brought to the physician by her parents due to intense perianal itching, especially during the night. The patient is otherwise healthy and her development has been normal. Physical examination shows perianal excoriation. Cellulose adhesive tape is applied to the perianal area shortly after she wakes in the morning. Microscopic analysis of the tape reveals the presence of eggs as shown in the image. What is the infective stage of this pathogen?

A 32-year-old man comes to the OPD due to diarrhea, flatulence, foul-smelling stools, and abdominal cramping. He recently returned home from a hiking trip. A smear of his stool sample is shown in the image. Which of the following is the drug of choice for this condition?
An outbreak of hepatitis in New Delhi was characterized by high incidence of fulminant hepatitis in pregnant women, who experienced a mortality rate of 20%. The virus responsible for the outbreak:
questions.correct_answer: A. Is an unenveloped RNA virus

questions.text: A 56-year-old man from chines origin comes to the clinic due to several months of progressive neck swelling. He has also had intermittent epistaxis and headaches. The patient has no chronic medical conditions and takes no medications. He does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs. Physical examination shows several enlarged, firm, and nontender cervical lymph nodes. Nasopharyngeal evaluation reveals a mass arising from the pharyngeal recess. Histopathological examination of the mass shows undifferentiated malignant cells of epithelial origin. Further analysis of these cells is most likely to reveal the presence of nucleic acid sequences from which of the following viruses?

questions.text: A 25 years old primigravida has 32 weeks of gestation with twin pregnancy. Which of the following is not a complication of multifetal pregnancy?

A 32 years old multiparous patient delivered the baby and during the third stage of labour, she had an inversion of uterus. Her placenta was seen attached to the inverted uterus. Which of the following is not correct in the management of this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediately remove the placenta and then reposit the uterus

options.label: C
options.text: Give uterotonic drug after the correction of the inversion

options.label: D
options.text: Give her blood transfusion for hemorrhagic shock.

questions.correct_answer: A. Immediately remove the placenta and then reposit the uterus

questions.text: A 33 years old multiparous patient had a full-term vaginal delivery. After the delivery, it was found that she suffered from injury to the perineal body which was torn completely. What is the degree of perineal tear in this case?
